  131: -define(SLEEP, 500).
  132: -define(CORRECT_PASSWORD, "hello test").
  133: -define(INCORRECT_PASSWORD, "hello").
  134: -define(BADARG_PASSWORD, hello).

  136: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  137: %% Common Test interface functions -----------------------------------
  138: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  139: 
  140: all() ->
  141:     [
  142:      {group, 'tlsv1.3'},
  143:      {group, 'tlsv1.2'},
  144:      {group, 'tlsv1.1'},
  145:      {group, 'tlsv1'},
  146:      {group, transport_socket}
  147:     ].
  148: 
  149: groups() ->
  150:     [
  151:      {'tlsv1.3', [], [{group, api_tests},
  152:                       tls_13_reject_change_cipher_spec_as_first_msg,
  153:                       tls_13_middlebox_reject_change_cipher_spec_as_first_msg
  154:                      ] ++ seq_test()},
  155:      {'tlsv1.2', [], [{group, api_tests}] ++ seq_test()},
  156:      {'tlsv1.1', [], [{group, api_tests}] ++ seq_test()},
  157:      {'tlsv1', [],  [{group, api_tests}] ++ seq_test()},
  158:      {transport_socket, [], [{group, api_tests}] ++ seq_test()},
  159:      {api_tests, [parallel], api_tests()}
  160:     ].
  161: 
  162: api_tests() ->
  163:     [
  164:      tls_upgrade,
  165:      tls_upgrade_new_opts,
  166:      tls_upgrade_new_opts_with_sni_fun,
  167:      tls_upgrade_with_timeout,
  168:      tls_upgrade_with_client_timeout,
  169:      tls_downgrade,
  170:      tls_shutdown,
  171:      tls_shutdown_write,
  172:      tls_shutdown_both,
  173:      tls_shutdown_error,
  174:      tls_sup_shutdown,
  175:      tls_password_correct,
  176:      tls_password_incorrect,
  177:      tls_password_badarg,
  178:      tls_client_closes_socket,
  179:      tls_closed_in_active_once,
  180:      tls_reset_in_active_once,
  181:      tls_tcp_msg,
  182:      tls_tcp_msg_big,
  183:      tls_dont_crash_on_handshake_garbage,
  184:      tls_tcp_error_propagation_in_active_mode,
  185:      tls_reject_warning_alert_in_initial_hs,
  186:      tls_reject_fake_warning_alert_in_initial_hs,
  187:      tls_app_data_in_initial_hs_state,
  188:      peername,
  189:      sockname,
  190:      tls_server_handshake_timeout,
  191:      transport_close,
  192:      emulated_options,
  193:      accept_pool,
  194:      reuseaddr
  195:     ].
  196: 
  197: seq_test() ->
  198:     [transport_close_in_inital_hello,tls_monitor_listener].
  199: 
  200: 
  201: init_per_suite(Config0) ->
  202:     catch application:stop(crypto),
  203:     try application:start(crypto) of
  204: 	ok ->
  205: 	    ssl_test_lib:clean_start(),
  206: 	    Config1 = ssl_test_lib:make_rsa_cert_with_protected_keyfile(Config0,
  207:                                                                         ?CORRECT_PASSWORD),
  208:             ssl_test_lib:make_ecdsa_cert(Config1)
  209:     catch _:_ ->
  210: 	    {skip, "Crypto did not start"}
  211:     end.
  212: 
  213: end_per_suite(_Config) ->
  214:     ssl:stop(),
  215:     application:unload(ssl),
  216:     application:stop(crypto).
  217: 
  218: init_per_group(GroupName, Config) ->
  219:     ssl_test_lib:init_per_group(GroupName, Config).
  220: 
  221: end_per_group(GroupName, Config) ->
  222:   ssl_test_lib:end_per_group(GroupName, Config).
  223: 
  224: init_per_testcase(Testcase, Config) when Testcase == tls_server_handshake_timeout;
  225:                                          Testcase == tls_upgrade_with_timeout ->
  226:     ct:timetrap({seconds, 10}),
  227:     Config;
  228: init_per_testcase(_, Config) ->
  229:     ct:timetrap({seconds, 5}),
  230:     Config.
  231: end_per_testcase(_TestCase, Config) ->
  232:     Config.
  233: 
  234: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  235: %% Test Cases --------------------------------------------------------
  236: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  237: tls_upgrade() ->
  238:     [{doc,"Test that you can upgrade an tcp connection to an ssl connection"}].
  239: 
  240: tls_upgrade(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  241:     ClientOpts = ssl_test_lib:ssl_options(client_rsa_opts, Config),
  242:     ServerOpts = ssl_test_lib:ssl_options(server_rsa_opts, Config),
  243:     {ClientNode, ServerNode, Hostname} = ssl_test_lib:run_where(Config),
  244:     TcpOpts = [binary, {reuseaddr, true}],
  245: 
  246:     Server = ssl_test_lib:start_upgrade_server([{node, ServerNode}, {port, 0},
  247: 						{from, self()},
  248: 						{mfa, {?MODULE,
  249: 						       upgrade_result, []}},
  250:                                                 {transport, proplists:get_value(transport, Config)},
  251:                                                 {tcp_options,[{active, false} | TcpOpts]},
  252: 						{ssl_options, [{verify, verify_peer} | ServerOpts]}]),
  253:     Port = ssl_test_lib:inet_port(Server),
  254:     Client = ssl_test_lib:start_upgrade_client([{node, ClientNode},
  255: 						{port, Port},
  256:                                                 {host, Hostname},
  257:                                                 {from, self()},
  258:                                                 {mfa, {?MODULE, upgrade_result, []}},
  259:                                                 {transport, proplists:get_value(transport, Config)},
  260:                                                 {tcp_options, [binary]},
  261:                                                 {ssl_options,  [{verify, verify_peer},
  262:                                                                 {server_name_indication, Hostname} | ClientOpts]}]),
  263: 
  264:     ?CT_LOG("Client ~p  Server ~p ~n", [Client, Server]),
  265: 
  266:     ssl_test_lib:check_result(Server, ok, Client, ok),
  267: 
  268:     ssl_test_lib:close(Server),
  269:     ssl_test_lib:close(Client).
  270: 
  271: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  272: tls_upgrade_new_opts() ->
  273:     [{doc,"Test that you can upgrade an tcp connection to an ssl connection and give new socket opts"}].
  274: 
  275: tls_upgrade_new_opts(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  276:     ClientOpts = ssl_test_lib:ssl_options(client_rsa_opts, Config),
  277:     ServerOpts = ssl_test_lib:ssl_options(server_rsa_opts, Config),
  278:     {ClientNode, ServerNode, Hostname} = ssl_test_lib:run_where(Config),
  279:     TcpOpts = [binary, {reuseaddr, true}],
  280: 
  281:     Server = ssl_test_lib:start_upgrade_server([{node, ServerNode}, {port, 0},
  282: 						{from, self()},
  283: 						{mfa, {?MODULE,upgrade_result_new_opts, []}},
  284: 						{tcp_options,[{active, false} | TcpOpts]},
  285:                                                 {transport, proplists:get_value(transport, Config)},
  286: 						{ssl_options, [{verify, verify_peer},
  287:                                                                {mode, list} | ServerOpts]}]),
  288:     Port = ssl_test_lib:inet_port(Server),
  289:     Client = ssl_test_lib:start_upgrade_client([{node, ClientNode},
  290: 						{port, Port},
  291:                                                 {host, Hostname},
  292:                                                 {from, self()},
  293:                                                 {mfa, {?MODULE, upgrade_result_new_opts, []}},
  294:                                                 {tcp_options, [binary]},
  295:                                                 {transport, proplists:get_value(transport, Config)},
  296:                                                 {ssl_options,  [{verify, verify_peer},
  297:                                                                 {mode, list},
  298:                                                                 {server_name_indication, Hostname} | ClientOpts]}]),
  299: 
  300:     ?CT_LOG("Client ~p  Server ~p ~n", [Client, Server]),
  301: 
  302:     ssl_test_lib:check_result(Server, ok, Client, ok),
  303: 
  304:     ssl_test_lib:close(Server),
  305:     ssl_test_lib:close(Client).
  306: 
  307: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  308: tls_upgrade_new_opts_with_sni_fun() ->
  309:     [{doc,"Test that you can upgrade an tcp connection to an ssl connection with new versions option provided by sni_fun"}].
  310: 
  311: tls_upgrade_new_opts_with_sni_fun(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  312:     ClientOpts = ssl_test_lib:ssl_options(client_rsa_verify_opts, Config),
  313:     ServerOpts = ssl_test_lib:ssl_options(server_rsa_opts, Config),
  314:     ServerEcdsaOpts = ssl_test_lib:ssl_options(server_ecdsa_opts, Config),
  315:     {ClientNode, ServerNode, Hostname} = ssl_test_lib:run_where(Config),
  316:     TcpOpts = [binary, {reuseaddr, true}],
  317:     Version = ssl_test_lib:protocol_version(Config),
  318:     NewVersions = new_versions(Version),
  319:     Ciphers = ssl:filter_cipher_suites(ssl:cipher_suites(all, Version),
  320:                                        [{key_exchange, fun(srp_rsa) -> false;
  321:                                                           (srp_dss) -> false;
  322:                                                           (_) -> true
  323:                                                        end}]),
  324: 
  325:     NewOpts = [{versions, NewVersions},
  326:                {ciphers, Ciphers},
  327:                {verify, verify_peer}],
  328: 
  329:     Server = ssl_test_lib:start_upgrade_server(
  330:                [{node, ServerNode}, {port, 0},
  331:                 {from, self()},
  332:                 {mfa, {?MODULE, upgrade_result, []}},
  333:                 {tcp_options,[{active, false} | TcpOpts]},
  334:                 {transport, proplists:get_value(transport, Config)},
  335:                 {ssl_options, [{versions, [Version |NewVersions]},
  336:                                {sni_fun, fun(_SNI) -> ServerOpts ++ NewOpts end}
  337:                               | proplists:delete(versions, ServerEcdsaOpts)]}]),
  338:     Port = ssl_test_lib:inet_port(Server),
  339:     Client = ssl_test_lib:start_upgrade_client(
  340:                [{node, ClientNode},
  341:                 {port, Port},
  342:                 {host, Hostname},
  343:                 {from, self()},
  344:                 {mfa, {?MODULE, upgrade_result, []}},
  345:                 {tcp_options, [binary]},
  346:                 {transport, proplists:get_value(transport, Config)},
  347:                 {ssl_options,  [{versions,  [Version |NewVersions]},
  348:                                 {ciphers, Ciphers},
  349:                                 {server_name_indication, Hostname} |
  350:                                 proplists:delete(versions, ClientOpts)]}]),
  351: 
  352:     ?CT_LOG("Client ~p  Server ~p ~n", [Client, Server]),
  353: 
  354:     ssl_test_lib:check_result(Server, ok, Client, ok),
  355: 
  356:     ssl_test_lib:close(Server),
  357:     ssl_test_lib:close(Client).
  358: 
  359: 
  360: 
  361: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  362: tls_upgrade_with_timeout() ->
  363:     [{doc,"Test handshake/3"}].
  364: 
  365: tls_upgrade_with_timeout(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  366:     ClientOpts = ssl_test_lib:ssl_options(client_rsa_opts, Config),
  367:     ServerOpts = ssl_test_lib:ssl_options(server_rsa_opts, Config),
  368:     {ClientNode, ServerNode, Hostname} = ssl_test_lib:run_where(Config),
  369:     TcpOpts = [binary, {reuseaddr, true}],
  370: 
  371:     Server = ssl_test_lib:start_upgrade_server([{node, ServerNode}, {port, 0},
  372: 						{from, self()},
  373: 						{timeout, 5000},
  374: 						{mfa, {?MODULE, upgrade_result, []}},
  375: 						{tcp_options, [{active, false} | TcpOpts]},
  376:                                                 {transport, proplists:get_value(transport, Config)},
  377: 						{ssl_options, [{verify, verify_peer} | ServerOpts]}]),
  378:     Port = ssl_test_lib:inet_port(Server),
  379:     Client = ssl_test_lib:start_upgrade_client([{node, ClientNode},
  380: 						{port, Port},
  381: 						{host, Hostname},
  382: 						{from, self()},
  383: 						{mfa, {?MODULE, upgrade_result, []}},
  384: 						{tcp_options, TcpOpts},
  385:                                                 {transport, proplists:get_value(transport, Config)},
  386: 						{ssl_options, [{verify, verify_peer},
  387:                                                                {server_name_indication, Hostname}
  388:                                                               | ClientOpts]}]),
  389: 
  390:     ?CT_LOG("Client ~p  Server ~p ~n", [Client, Server]),
  391: 
  392:     ssl_test_lib:check_result(Server, ok, Client, ok),
  393: 
  394:     ssl_test_lib:close(Server),
  395:     ssl_test_lib:close(Client).
  396: 
  397: tls_upgrade_with_client_timeout() ->
  398:     [{doc,"Test upgrade with connect/3 and a timeout value"}].
  399: 
  400: tls_upgrade_with_client_timeout(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  401:     ClientOpts = ssl_test_lib:ssl_options(client_rsa_opts, Config),
  402:     ServerOpts = ssl_test_lib:ssl_options(server_rsa_opts, Config),
  403:     {ClientNode, ServerNode, Hostname} = ssl_test_lib:run_where(Config),
  404:     TcpOpts = [binary, {reuseaddr, true}],
  405: 
  406:     Server = ssl_test_lib:start_upgrade_server(
  407:                [{node, ServerNode}, {port, 0},
  408:                 {from, self()},
  409:                 {mfa, {?MODULE, upgrade_result, []}},
  410:                 {tcp_options, [{active, false} | TcpOpts]},
  411:                 {transport, proplists:get_value(transport, Config)},
  412:                 {ssl_options, [{verify, verify_peer} | ServerOpts]}]),
  413:     Port = ssl_test_lib:inet_port(Server),
  414:     Client = ssl_test_lib:start_upgrade_client_error(
  415:                [{node, ClientNode},
  416:                 {port, Port},
  417:                 {host, Hostname},
  418:                 {from, self()},
  419:                 {timeout, 0},
  420:                 {mfa, {?MODULE, upgrade_result, []}},
  421:                 {tcp_options, [binary]},
  422:                 {transport, proplists:get_value(transport, Config)},
  423:                 {ssl_options,  [{verify, verify_peer},
  424:                                 {server_name_indication, Hostname} | ClientOpts]}]),
  425: 
  426:     ?CT_LOG("Client ~p  Server ~p", [Client, Server]),
  427:     ok = ssl_test_lib:check_result(Client, {error, timeout}),
  428:     ssl_test_lib:close(Server).
  429: 
  430: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  431: tls_downgrade() ->
  432:       [{doc,"Test that you can downgarde an ssl connection to an tcp connection"}].
  433: tls_downgrade(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  434:     ClientOpts = ssl_test_lib:ssl_options(client_rsa_opts, Config),
  435:     ServerOpts = ssl_test_lib:ssl_options(server_rsa_opts, Config),
  436: 
  437:     {ClientNode, ServerNode, Hostname} = ssl_test_lib:run_where(Config),
  438: 
  439:     Server = ssl_test_lib:start_server([{node, ServerNode}, {port, 0},
  440: 					{from, self()},
  441: 					{mfa, {?MODULE, tls_downgrade_result, [self()]}},
  442: 					{options, [{active, false}, {verify, verify_peer} | ServerOpts]}]),
  443:     Port = ssl_test_lib:inet_port(Server),
  444:     Client = ssl_test_lib:start_client([{node, ClientNode}, {port, Port},
  445: 					{host, Hostname},
  446: 					{from, self()},
  447: 					{mfa, {?MODULE, tls_downgrade_result, [self()]}},
  448: 					{options, [{active, false}, {verify, verify_peer} | ClientOpts]}]),
  449: 
  450:     ssl_test_lib:check_result(Server, ready, Client, ready),
  451: 
  452:     Server ! go,
  453:     Client ! go,
  454: 
  455:     ssl_test_lib:check_result(Server, ok, Client, ok),
  456:     ssl_test_lib:close(Server),
  457:     ssl_test_lib:close(Client).
  458: 
  459: 
  460: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  461: tls_shutdown() ->
  462:     [{doc,"Test API function ssl:shutdown/2"}].
  463: tls_shutdown(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  464:     ClientOpts = ssl_test_lib:ssl_options(client_rsa_opts, Config),
  465:     ServerOpts = ssl_test_lib:ssl_options(server_rsa_opts, Config),
  466:     {ClientNode, ServerNode, Hostname} = ssl_test_lib:run_where(Config),
  467:     Server = ssl_test_lib:start_server([{node, ServerNode}, {port, 0},
  468: 					{from, self()},
  469:                                         {mfa, {?MODULE, tls_shutdown_result, [server]}},
  470:                                         {options, [{exit_on_close, false},
  471:                                                    {active, false} | ServerOpts]}]),
  472:     Port = ssl_test_lib:inet_port(Server),
  473:     Client = ssl_test_lib:start_client([{node, ClientNode}, {port, Port},
  474: 					{host, Hostname},
  475: 					{from, self()},
  476: 					{mfa,
  477: 					 {?MODULE, tls_shutdown_result, [client]}},
  478: 					{options,
  479: 					 [{exit_on_close, false},
  480: 					  {active, false} | ClientOpts]}]),
  481: 
  482:     ssl_test_lib:check_result(Server, ok, Client, ok),
  483: 
  484:     ssl_test_lib:close(Server),
  485:     ssl_test_lib:close(Client).
  486: 
  487: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  488: tls_shutdown_write() ->
  489:     [{doc,"Test API function ssl:shutdown/2 with option write."}].
  490: tls_shutdown_write(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  491:     ClientOpts = ssl_test_lib:ssl_options(client_rsa_opts, Config),
  492:     ServerOpts = ssl_test_lib:ssl_options(server_rsa_opts, Config),
  493:     {ClientNode, ServerNode, Hostname} = ssl_test_lib:run_where(Config),
  494:     Server = ssl_test_lib:start_server([{node, ServerNode}, {port, 0},
  495: 					{from, self()},
  496: 			   {mfa, {?MODULE, tls_shutdown_write_result, [server]}},
  497: 			   {options, [{active, false} | ServerOpts]}]),
  498:     Port = ssl_test_lib:inet_port(Server),
  499:     Client = ssl_test_lib:start_client([{node, ClientNode}, {port, Port},
  500: 					{host, Hostname},
  501: 			   {from, self()},
  502: 			   {mfa, {?MODULE, tls_shutdown_write_result, [client]}},
  503: 			   {options, [{active, false} | ClientOpts]}]),
  504: 
  505:     ssl_test_lib:check_result(Server, ok, Client, {error, closed}).
  506: 
  507: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  508: tls_shutdown_both() ->
  509:     [{doc,"Test API function ssl:shutdown/2 with option both."}].
  510: tls_shutdown_both(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  511:     ClientOpts = ssl_test_lib:ssl_options(client_rsa_opts, Config),
  512:     ServerOpts = ssl_test_lib:ssl_options(server_rsa_opts, Config),
  513:     {ClientNode, ServerNode, Hostname} = ssl_test_lib:run_where(Config),
  514:     Server = ssl_test_lib:start_server([{node, ServerNode}, {port, 0},
  515: 					{from, self()},
  516: 			   {mfa, {?MODULE, tls_shutdown_both_result, [server]}},
  517: 			   {options, [{active, false} | ServerOpts]}]),
  518:     Port  = ssl_test_lib:inet_port(Server),
  519:     Client = ssl_test_lib:start_client([{node, ClientNode}, {port, Port},
  520: 					{host, Hostname},
  521: 			   {from, self()},
  522: 			   {mfa, {?MODULE, tls_shutdown_both_result, [client]}},
  523: 			   {options, [{active, false} | ClientOpts]}]),
  524: 
  525:     ssl_test_lib:check_result(Server, ok, Client, {error, closed}).
  526: 
  527: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  528: tls_shutdown_error() ->
  529:     [{doc,"Test ssl:shutdown/2 error handling"}].
  530: tls_shutdown_error(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  531:     ServerOpts = ssl_test_lib:ssl_options(server_rsa_opts, Config),
  532:     Port = ssl_test_lib:inet_port(node()),
  533:     {ok, Listen} = ssl:listen(Port, ServerOpts),
  534:     {error, enotconn} = ssl:shutdown(Listen, read_write),
  535:     ok = ssl:close(Listen),
  536:     {error, _} = ssl:shutdown(Listen, read_write).
  537: 
  538: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  539: tls_client_closes_socket() ->
  540:     [{doc,"Test what happens when client closes socket before handshake is completed"}].
  541: 
  542: tls_client_closes_socket(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  543:     ServerOpts = ssl_test_lib:ssl_options(server_rsa_opts, Config),
  544:     {ClientNode, ServerNode, Hostname} = ssl_test_lib:run_where(Config),
  545:     TcpOpts = [binary, {reuseaddr, true}],
  546: 
  547:     Server = ssl_test_lib:start_upgrade_server_error(
  548:                [{node, ServerNode}, {port, 0},
  549:                 {from, self()},
  550:                 {tcp_options, TcpOpts},
  551:                 {transport, proplists:get_value(transport, Config)},
  552:                 {ssl_options, ServerOpts}]),
  553:     Port = ssl_test_lib:inet_port(Server),
  554: 
  555:     Connect = fun() ->
  556: 		      {ok, _Socket} = rpc:call(ClientNode, gen_tcp, connect,
  557:                                                [Hostname, Port, [binary]]),
  558: 		      %% Make sure that handshake is called before
  559: 		      %% client process ends and closes socket.
  560: 		      ct:sleep(?SLEEP)
  561: 	      end,
  562: 
  563:     _Client = spawn_link(Connect),
  564: 
  565:     ssl_test_lib:check_result(Server, {error,closed}).
  566: 
  567: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  568: tls_reset_in_active_once() ->
  569:     [{doc, "Test that ssl_closed is delivered in active once with non-empty buffer, check ERL-420."}].
  570: 
  571: tls_reset_in_active_once(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  572:     ClientOpts = ssl_test_lib:ssl_options(client_rsa_opts, Config),
  573:     ServerOpts = ssl_test_lib:ssl_options(server_rsa_opts, Config),
  574:     {_ClientNode, _ServerNode, Hostname} = ssl_test_lib:run_where(Config),
  575:     TcpOpts = [binary, {reuseaddr, true}],
  576:     Port = ssl_test_lib:inet_port(node()),
  577:     Server = fun() ->
  578:                      case proplists:get_value(transport, Config) of
  579:                          socket ->
  580:                              {ok, Listen} = tls_socket_tcp:listen(Port, TcpOpts),
  581:                              {ok, TcpServerSocket} = socket:accept(Listen),
  582:                              {ok, ServerSocket} = ssl:handshake(TcpServerSocket, ServerOpts),
  583:                              lists:foreach(
  584:                                fun(_) ->
  585:                                        ssl:send(ServerSocket, "some random message\r\n")
  586:                                end, lists:seq(1, 20)),
  587:                              %% Close TCP instead of SSL socket to trigger the bug:
  588:                              socket:close(TcpServerSocket),
  589:                              socket:close(Listen);
  590:                          _ ->
  591:                              {ok, Listen} = gen_tcp:listen(Port, TcpOpts),
  592:                              {ok, TcpServerSocket} = gen_tcp:accept(Listen),
  593:                              {ok, ServerSocket} = ssl:handshake(TcpServerSocket, ServerOpts),
  594:                              lists:foreach(
  595:                                fun(_) ->
  596:                                        ssl:send(ServerSocket, "some random message\r\n")
  597:                                end, lists:seq(1, 20)),
  598:                              %% Close TCP instead of SSL socket to trigger the bug:
  599:                              gen_tcp:close(TcpServerSocket),
  600:                              gen_tcp:close(Listen)
  601:                      end
  602: 	     end,
  603:     spawn_link(Server),
  604:     {ok, Socket} = ssl:connect(Hostname, Port, [{active, false} | ClientOpts]),
  605:     Result = tls_closed_in_active_once_loop(Socket),
  606:     ssl:close(Socket),
  607:     case Result of
  608: 	ok -> ok;
  609: 	_ -> ct:fail(Result)
  610:     end.
  611: 
  612: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  613: tls_closed_in_active_once() ->
  614:     [{doc, "Test that active once can be used to deliver not only all data"
  615:       " but even the close message, see ERL-1409, in normal operation."
  616:       " This is also test, with slightly different circumstances in"
  617:       " the old tls_closed_in_active_once test"
  618:       " renamed tls_reset_in_active_once"}].
  619: 
  620: tls_closed_in_active_once(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  621:     ClientOpts = ssl_test_lib:ssl_options(client_rsa_opts, Config),
  622:     ServerOpts0 = ssl_test_lib:ssl_options(server_rsa_opts, Config),
  623:     ServerOpts = proplists:delete(cb_info, ServerOpts0),
  624:     {_ClientNode, _ServerNode, Hostname} = ssl_test_lib:run_where(Config),
  625:     TcpOpts = [binary, {reuseaddr, true}],
  626:     Port = ssl_test_lib:inet_port(node()),
  627:     Server = fun() ->
  628: 		     {ok, Listen} = gen_tcp:listen(Port, TcpOpts),
  629: 		     {ok, TcpServerSocket} = gen_tcp:accept(Listen),
  630: 		     {ok, ServerSocket} = ssl:handshake(TcpServerSocket, ServerOpts),
  631: 		     lists:foreach(
  632: 		       fun(_) ->
  633: 			       ssl:send(ServerSocket, "some random message\r\n")
  634: 		       end, lists:seq(1, 20)),
  635: 		     ssl:close(ServerSocket)
  636: 	     end,
  637:     spawn_link(Server),
  638:     {ok, Socket} = ssl:connect(Hostname, Port, [{active, false} | ClientOpts]),
  639:     Result = tls_closed_in_active_once_loop(Socket),
  640:     ssl:close(Socket),
  641:     case Result of
  642: 	ok -> ok;
  643: 	_ -> ct:fail(Result)
  644:     end.
  645: 
  646: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  647: tls_monitor_listener() ->
  648:     [{doc, "Check that TLS server processes are shutdown when listener socket is closed."
  649:       "Note that individual already established connections may live longer."}].
  650: 
  651: tls_monitor_listener(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  652:     ServerOpts = ssl_test_lib:ssl_options(server_rsa_opts, Config),
  653:     ClientOpts = ssl_test_lib:ssl_options(client_rsa_opts, Config),
  654:     Version = ssl_test_lib:protocol_version(Config),
  655:     {ClientNode, ServerNode, Hostname} = ssl_test_lib:run_where(Config),
  656: 
  657:     Server1 = ssl_test_lib:start_server([{node, ServerNode}, {port, 0},
  658: 					{from, self()},
  659:                                          {mfa, {ssl_test_lib, send_recv_result_active, []}},
  660:                                          {options, tls_monitor_listen_opts(Version, ServerOpts)}]),
  661:     Port1 = ssl_test_lib:inet_port(Server1),
  662: 
  663:     Server2 = ssl_test_lib:start_server([{node, ServerNode}, {port, 0},
  664: 					{from, self()},
  665:                                          {options, tls_monitor_listen_opts(Version, ServerOpts)}]),
  666:     _Port2 = ssl_test_lib:inet_port(Server2),
  667: 
  668:     2 = count_children(workers, ssl_listen_tracker_sup),
  669: 
  670:     Sessions = session_info(Version),
  671: 
  672:     true = (Sessions == 2),
  673: 
  674:     Client1 = ssl_test_lib:start_client([{node, ClientNode}, {port, Port1},
  675:                                          {host, Hostname},
  676:                                          {from, self()},
  677:                                          {mfa, {ssl_test_lib, send_recv_result_active, []}},
  678:                                          {options, tls_monitor_client_opts(Version, ClientOpts)}
  679: 					]),
  680: 
  681:     ssl_test_lib:check_result(Server1, ok, Client1, ok),
  682:     Monitor = erlang:monitor(process, Server1),
  683:     ssl_test_lib:close(Server1),
  684:     receive
  685:         {'DOWN', Monitor, _, _, _} ->
  686:             ct:sleep(1000)
  687:     end,
  688: 
  689: 
  690:     Sessions1 = session_info(Version),
  691:     true = (Sessions1 == 1),
  692: 
  693:     1 = count_children(workers, ssl_listen_tracker_sup).
  694: 
  695: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  696: tls_tcp_msg() ->
  697:     [{doc,"Test what happens when a tcp tries to connect, i,e. a bad (ssl) packet is sent first"}].
  698: 
  699: tls_tcp_msg(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  700:     ServerOpts = ssl_test_lib:ssl_options(server_rsa_opts, Config),
  701:     {_, ServerNode, Hostname} = ssl_test_lib:run_where(Config),
  702:     TcpOpts = [binary, {reuseaddr, true}, {active, false}],
  703: 
  704:     Server = ssl_test_lib:start_upgrade_server_error(
  705:                [{node, ServerNode}, {port, 0},
  706:                 {from, self()},
  707:                 {timeout, 5000},
  708:                 {mfa, {?MODULE, dummy, []}},
  709:                 {transport, proplists:get_value(transport, Config)},
  710:                 {tcp_options, TcpOpts},
  711:                 {ssl_options, ServerOpts}]),
  712:     Port = ssl_test_lib:inet_port(Server),
  713: 
  714:     {ok, Socket} = gen_tcp:connect(Hostname, Port, [binary, {packet, 0}]),
  715:     ?CT_LOG("connected to Server ~p ~n", [Server]),
  716:     gen_tcp:send(Socket, "<SOME GARBLED NON SSL MESSAGE>"),
  717: 
  718:     receive
  719: 	{tcp_closed, Socket} ->
  720: 	    receive
  721: 		{Server, {error, Error}} ->
  722: 		    ?CT_LOG("Error ~p", [Error])
  723: 	    end
  724:     end.
  725: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  726: tls_tcp_msg_big() ->
  727:     [{doc,"Test what happens when a tcp tries to connect, i,e. a bad big (ssl) packet is sent first"}].
  728: 
  729: tls_tcp_msg_big(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  730:     process_flag(trap_exit, true),
  731:     ServerOpts = ssl_test_lib:ssl_options(server_rsa_opts, Config),
  732:     {_, ServerNode, Hostname} = ssl_test_lib:run_where(Config),
  733:     TcpOpts = [binary, {reuseaddr, true}],
  734: 
  735:     Rand = crypto:strong_rand_bytes(?MAX_CIPHER_TEXT_LENGTH+1),
  736:     Server = ssl_test_lib:start_upgrade_server_error([{node, ServerNode}, {port, 0},
  737: 						      {from, self()},
  738: 						      {timeout, 5000},
  739: 						      {mfa, {?MODULE, dummy, []}},
  740: 						      {tcp_options, TcpOpts},
  741:                                                       {transport, proplists:get_value(transport, Config)},
  742: 						      {ssl_options, ServerOpts}]),
  743:     Port = ssl_test_lib:inet_port(Server),
  744: 
  745:     {ok, Socket} = gen_tcp:connect(Hostname, Port, [binary, {packet, 0}]),
  746:     ?CT_LOG("connected to Server ~p ~n", [Server]),
  747: 
  748:     gen_tcp:send(Socket, <<?BYTE(0),
  749: 			   ?BYTE(3), ?BYTE(1), ?UINT16(?MAX_CIPHER_TEXT_LENGTH), Rand/binary>>),
  750: 
  751:     receive
  752: 	{tcp_closed, Socket} ->
  753: 	    receive
  754: 		{Server, {error, timeout}} ->
  755: 		    ct:fail("hangs");
  756: 		{Server, {error, Error}} ->
  757: 		    ?CT_LOG("Error ~p", [Error]);
  758: 		{'EXIT', Server, _} ->
  759: 		    ok
  760: 	    end
  761:     end.
  762: 
  763: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  764: tls_dont_crash_on_handshake_garbage() ->
  765:     [{doc, "Ensure SSL server worker thows an alert on garbage during handshake "
  766:       "instead of crashing and exposing state to user code"}].
  767: 
  768: tls_dont_crash_on_handshake_garbage(Config) ->
  769:     ServerOpts = ssl_test_lib:ssl_options(server_rsa_opts, Config),
  770:     Version = ssl_test_lib:protocol_version(Config),
  771:     {_ClientNode, ServerNode, Hostname} = ssl_test_lib:run_where(Config),
  772:     Ciphers = ssl:filter_cipher_suites(ssl:cipher_suites(all, Version),
  773:                                        [{key_exchange, fun(srp_rsa) -> false;
  774:                                                           (srp_dss) -> false;
  775:                                                           (_) -> true
  776:                                                        end}]),
  777: 
  778: 
  779:     Server = ssl_test_lib:start_server([{node, ServerNode}, {port, 0},
  780:                                         {from, self()},
  781:                                         {mfa, ssl_test_lib, no_result},
  782:                                         {options, [{versions, [Version]}, {ciphers, Ciphers} | ServerOpts]}]),
  783:     Port = ssl_test_lib:inet_port(Server),
  784: 
  785:     {ok, Socket} = gen_tcp:connect(Hostname, Port, [binary, {active, false}]),
  786: 
  787:     %% Send hello and garbage record
  788:     ok = gen_tcp:send(Socket,
  789:                       [<<22, 3,3, 49:16, 1, 45:24, 3,3, % client_hello
  790:                          16#deadbeef:256, % 32 'random' bytes = 256 bits
  791:                          0, 6:16, 0,255, 0,61, 0,57, 1, 0 >>, % some hello values
  792:                        <<22, 3,3, 5:16, 92,64,37,228,209>> % garbage
  793:                       ]),
  794:     %% Send unexpected change_cipher_spec
  795:     ok = gen_tcp:send(Socket, <<20, 3,3, 12:16, 111,40,244,7,137,224,16,109,197,110,249,152>>),
  796:     gen_tcp:close(Socket),
  797:     % Ensure we receive an alert, not sudden disconnect
  798:     case Version of
  799:         'tlsv1.3' ->
  800:             ssl_test_lib:check_server_alert(Server, protocol_version);
  801:         _ ->
  802:             ssl_test_lib:check_server_alert(Server, handshake_failure)
  803:     end.
  804: 
  805: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  806: tls_tcp_error_propagation_in_active_mode() ->
  807:     [{doc,"Test that process receives {ssl_error, Socket, closed} when tcp error ocurres"}].
  808: tls_tcp_error_propagation_in_active_mode(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  809:     ClientOpts = ssl_test_lib:ssl_options(client_rsa_opts, Config),
  810:     ServerOpts = ssl_test_lib:ssl_options(server_rsa_opts, Config),
  811: 
  812:     {ClientNode, ServerNode, Hostname} = ssl_test_lib:run_where(Config),
  813: 
  814:     Server  = ssl_test_lib:start_server([{node, ServerNode}, {port, 0},
  815: 					 {from, self()},
  816: 					 {mfa, {ssl_test_lib, no_result, []}},
  817: 					 {options, ServerOpts}]),
  818:     Port = ssl_test_lib:inet_port(Server),
  819:     {Client, SslSocket} = ssl_test_lib:start_client([return_socket,
  820:                                                      {node, ClientNode}, {port, Port},
  821:                                                      {host, Hostname},
  822:                                                      {from, self()},
  823:                                                      {mfa, {?MODULE, receive_msg, []}},
  824:                                                      {options, ClientOpts}]),
  825:     #sslsocket{connection_handler = Pid} = SslSocket,
  826: 
  827:     {status, _, _, StatusInfo} = sys:get_status(Pid),
  828:     [_, _,_, _, Prop] = StatusInfo,
  829:     State = ssl_test_lib:state(Prop),
  830:     StaticEnv = State#state.static_env,
  831:     Socket = StaticEnv#static_env.socket,
  832:     %% Fake tcp error
  833:     case proplists:get_value(transport, Config) of
  834:         socket ->
  835:             Pid ! {'$socket', Socket, abort, etimedout};
  836:         _ ->
  837:             Pid ! {tcp_error, Socket, etimedout}
  838:     end,
  839: 
  840:     ssl_test_lib:check_result(Client, {ssl_closed, SslSocket}).
  841: 
  842: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  843: tls_sup_shutdown() ->
  844:     [{doc,"Test that terminate behaves correctly for exit(shutdown) as done by supervisor at application shutdown"}].
  845: tls_sup_shutdown(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  846:     ClientOpts = ssl_test_lib:ssl_options(client_rsa_opts, Config),
  847:     ServerOpts = ssl_test_lib:ssl_options(server_rsa_opts, Config),
  848: 
  849:     {ClientNode, ServerNode, Hostname} = ssl_test_lib:run_where(Config),
  850: 
  851:     Server  = ssl_test_lib:start_server([{node, ServerNode}, {port, 0},
  852: 					 {from, self()},
  853: 					 {mfa, {?MODULE, receive_msg, []}},
  854: 					 {options, ServerOpts}]),
  855:     Port = ssl_test_lib:inet_port(Server),
  856: 
  857:     {_, #sslsocket{connection_handler = Pid}} = ssl_test_lib:start_client([return_socket,
  858:                                                                    {node, ClientNode}, {port, Port},
  859:                                                                    {host, Hostname},
  860:                                                                    {from, self()},
  861:                                                                    {mfa, {ssl_test_lib, no_result, []}},
  862:                                                                    {options, [{active, false} | ClientOpts]}]),
  863:     exit(Pid, shutdown),
  864: 
  865:     receive
  866:         {Server, {ssl_closed, _}} ->
  867:             ok;
  868:         Msg ->
  869:           ct:fail(Msg)
  870:     end.
  871: 
  872: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  873: tls_reject_warning_alert_in_initial_hs() ->
  874:     [{doc,"Test sending warning ALERT instead of client hello"}].
  875: tls_reject_warning_alert_in_initial_hs(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  876:     ServerOpts = ssl_test_lib:ssl_options(server_rsa_opts, Config),
  877:     {_Clientnode, ServerNode, _Hostname} = ssl_test_lib:run_where(Config),
  878:     {Major, Minor} = case ssl_test_lib:protocol_version(Config, tuple) of
  879:                          ?TLS_1_3 ->
  880:                              ?TLS_1_2;
  881:                          Other ->
  882:                              Other
  883:                      end,
  884: 
  885:     Server  = ssl_test_lib:start_server([{node, ServerNode}, {port, 0},
  886: 					 {from, self()},
  887: 					 {mfa, {ssl_test_lib, no_result, []}},
  888: 					 {options, [{versions, [ssl_test_lib:protocol_version(Config)]} |
  889:                                                     proplists:delete(versions, ServerOpts)]}]),
  890:     Port = ssl_test_lib:inet_port(Server),
  891:     {ok, Socket}  = gen_tcp:connect("localhost", Port, [{active, false}, binary]),
  892:     NoRenegotiateAlert = <<?BYTE(?ALERT), ?BYTE(Major), ?BYTE(Minor), ?UINT16(2), ?BYTE(?WARNING), ?BYTE(?NO_RENEGOTIATION)>>,
  893:     gen_tcp:send(Socket, NoRenegotiateAlert),
  894:     UnexpectedMsgAlert = <<?BYTE(?ALERT), ?BYTE(Major), ?BYTE(Minor), ?UINT16(2), ?BYTE(?FATAL), ?BYTE(?UNEXPECTED_MESSAGE)>>,
  895:     {ok, UnexpectedMsgAlert} = gen_tcp:recv(Socket, 7),
  896:     {error, closed} = gen_tcp:recv(Socket, 0).
  897: 
  898: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  899: tls_reject_fake_warning_alert_in_initial_hs() ->
  900:     [{doc,"Test sending 'fake' warning ALERT covers different function clause pre TLS-1.3"}].
  901: tls_reject_fake_warning_alert_in_initial_hs(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  902:     ServerOpts = ssl_test_lib:ssl_options(server_rsa_opts, Config),
  903:     {_ClientNode, ServerNode, _Hostname} = ssl_test_lib:run_where(Config),
  904:     {Major, Minor} = case ssl_test_lib:protocol_version(Config, tuple) of
  905:                          ?TLS_1_3 ->
  906:                              ?TLS_1_2;
  907:                          Other ->
  908:                              Other
  909:                      end,
  910:     Server  = ssl_test_lib:start_server([{node, ServerNode}, {port, 0},
  911: 					 {from, self()},
  912: 					 {mfa, {ssl_test_lib, no_result, []}},
  913: 					 {options, [{versions, [ssl_test_lib:protocol_version(Config)]} | ServerOpts]}]),
  914:     Port = ssl_test_lib:inet_port(Server),
  915:     {ok, Socket}  = gen_tcp:connect("localhost", Port, [{active, false}, binary]),
  916:     NoRenegotiateAlert = <<?BYTE(?ALERT), ?BYTE(Major), ?BYTE(Minor), ?UINT16(2), ?BYTE(?WARNING), ?BYTE(?UNEXPECTED_MESSAGE)>>,
  917:     gen_tcp:send(Socket, NoRenegotiateAlert),
  918:     UnexpectedMsgAlert = <<?BYTE(?ALERT), ?BYTE(Major), ?BYTE(Minor), ?UINT16(2), ?BYTE(?FATAL), ?BYTE(?UNEXPECTED_MESSAGE)>>,
  919:     {ok, UnexpectedMsgAlert} = gen_tcp:recv(Socket, 7),
  920:     {error, closed} = gen_tcp:recv(Socket, 0).

  922: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  923: tls_app_data_in_initial_hs_state() ->
  924:      [{doc,"Test sending application data instead of initial client hello. In TLS-1.3 application data can be sent",
  925:        "in first round trip but not before client hello."}].
  926: tls_app_data_in_initial_hs_state(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  927:     ServerOpts = ssl_test_lib:ssl_options(server_rsa_opts, Config),
  928:     {_ClientNode, ServerNode, _Hostname} = ssl_test_lib:run_where(Config),
  929:     Version = ssl_test_lib:protocol_version(Config, tuple),
  930:     {Major, Minor} = case Version of
  931:                          ?TLS_1_3 ->
  932:                              ?TLS_1_2;
  933:                          Other ->
  934:                              Other
  935:                      end,
  936:     Server  = ssl_test_lib:start_server([{node, ServerNode}, {port, 0},
  937: 					 {from, self()},
  938: 					 {mfa, {ssl_test_lib, no_result, []}},
  939: 					 {options, [{versions, [ssl_test_lib:protocol_version(Config)]} | ServerOpts]}]),
  940:     Port = ssl_test_lib:inet_port(Server),
  941:     {ok, Socket}  = gen_tcp:connect("localhost", Port, [{active, false}, binary]),
  942:     AppData = case Version of
  943:                   ?TLS_1_3 ->
  944:                       <<?BYTE(?APPLICATION_DATA), ?BYTE(3), ?BYTE(3), ?UINT16(4), ?BYTE($F), 
  945:                         ?BYTE($O), ?BYTE($O), ?BYTE(?APPLICATION_DATA)>>;
  946:                   _ ->
  947:                      <<?BYTE(?APPLICATION_DATA), ?BYTE(Major), ?BYTE(Minor), 
  948:                        ?UINT16(3), ?BYTE($F), ?BYTE($O), ?BYTE($O)>>
  949:               end,
  950:     gen_tcp:send(Socket, AppData),
  951:     UnexpectedMsgAlert = <<?BYTE(?ALERT), ?BYTE(Major), ?BYTE(Minor), ?UINT16(2), 
  952:                            ?BYTE(?FATAL), ?BYTE(?UNEXPECTED_MESSAGE)>>,
  953:     {ok, UnexpectedMsgAlert} = gen_tcp:recv(Socket, 7),
  954:     {error, closed} = gen_tcp:recv(Socket, 0).
  955: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  956: tls_13_reject_change_cipher_spec_as_first_msg() ->
  957:      [{doc,"change_cipher_spec messages can be sent in TLS-1.3 middlebox_comp_mode, but can not be sent as first msg"}].
  958: tls_13_reject_change_cipher_spec_as_first_msg(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  959:     ServerOpts = ssl_test_lib:ssl_options(server_rsa_opts, Config),
  960:     {_ClientNode, ServerNode, _Hostname} = ssl_test_lib:run_where(Config),
  961:     Server  = ssl_test_lib:start_server([{node, ServerNode}, {port, 0},
  962:                                          {from, self()},
  963:                                          {mfa, {ssl_test_lib, no_result, []}},
  964:                                          {options, [{versions, [ssl_test_lib:protocol_version(Config)]} | ServerOpts]}]),
  965:     Port = ssl_test_lib:inet_port(Server),
  966:     {ok, Socket}  = gen_tcp:connect("localhost", Port, [{active, false}, binary]),
  967:     ChangeCipherSpec = <<?BYTE(?CHANGE_CIPHER_SPEC), ?BYTE(3), ?BYTE(3),
  968:                          ?UINT16(1), ?BYTE(?CHANGE_CIPHER_SPEC_PROTO)>>,
  969:     gen_tcp:send(Socket, ChangeCipherSpec),
  970:     UnexpectedMsgAlert = <<?BYTE(?ALERT), ?BYTE(3), ?BYTE(3), ?UINT16(2),
  971:                            ?BYTE(?FATAL), ?BYTE(?UNEXPECTED_MESSAGE)>>,
  972:     {ok, UnexpectedMsgAlert} = gen_tcp:recv(Socket, 7),
  973:     {error, closed} = gen_tcp:recv(Socket, 0).
  974: 
  975: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  976: tls_13_middlebox_reject_change_cipher_spec_as_first_msg() ->
  977:      [{doc,"change_cipher_spec messages can be sent in TLS-1.3 middlebox_comp_mode, but can not be sent as first msg"}].
  978: tls_13_middlebox_reject_change_cipher_spec_as_first_msg(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  979:     ServerOpts = ssl_test_lib:ssl_options(server_rsa_opts, Config),
  980:     {_ClientNode, ServerNode, _Hostname} = ssl_test_lib:run_where(Config),
  981:     Server  = ssl_test_lib:start_server([{node, ServerNode}, {port, 0},
  982:                                          {from, self()},
  983:                                          {mfa, {ssl_test_lib, no_result, []}},
  984:                                          {options, [{middlebox_comp_mode, false},
  985:                                                     {versions, [ssl_test_lib:protocol_version(Config)]}
  986:                                                    | ServerOpts]}]),
  987:     Port = ssl_test_lib:inet_port(Server),
  988:     {ok, Socket}  = gen_tcp:connect("localhost", Port, [{active, false}, binary]),
  989:     ChangeCipherSpec = <<?BYTE(?CHANGE_CIPHER_SPEC), ?BYTE(3), ?BYTE(3),
  990:                          ?UINT16(1), ?BYTE(?CHANGE_CIPHER_SPEC_PROTO)>>,
  991:     gen_tcp:send(Socket, ChangeCipherSpec),
  992:     UnexpectedMsgAlert = <<?BYTE(?ALERT), ?BYTE(3), ?BYTE(3), ?UINT16(2),
  993:                            ?BYTE(?FATAL), ?BYTE(?UNEXPECTED_MESSAGE)>>,
  994:     {ok, UnexpectedMsgAlert} = gen_tcp:recv(Socket, 7),
  995:     {error, closed} = gen_tcp:recv(Socket, 0).
  996: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  997: peername() ->
  998:     [{doc,"Test API function peername/1"}].
  999: 
 1000: peername(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1001:     ClientOpts = ssl_test_lib:ssl_options(client_rsa_opts, Config),
 1002:     ServerOpts = ssl_test_lib:ssl_options(server_rsa_opts, Config),
 1003:     {ClientNode, ServerNode, Hostname} = ssl_test_lib:run_where(Config),
 1004:     Server = ssl_test_lib:start_server([{node, ServerNode}, {port, 0},
 1005: 					{from, self()},
 1006: 			   {mfa, {ssl, peername, []}},
 1007: 			   {options, ServerOpts}]),
 1008:     Port = ssl_test_lib:inet_port(Server),
 1009:     Client = ssl_test_lib:start_client([{node, ClientNode}, {port, Port},
 1010: 					{host, Hostname},
 1011: 					{from, self()},
 1012: 					{mfa, {ssl, peername, []}},
 1013: 					{options, [{port, 0} | ClientOpts]}]),
 1014: 
 1015:     ClientPort = ssl_test_lib:inet_port(Client),
 1016:     ServerIp = ssl_test_lib:node_to_hostip(ServerNode, server),
 1017:     ClientIp = ssl_test_lib:node_to_hostip(ClientNode, client),
 1018:     ServerMsg = {ok, {ClientIp, ClientPort}},
 1019:     ClientMsg = {ok, {ServerIp, Port}},
 1020: 
 1021:     ?CT_LOG("Client ~p  Server ~p ~n", [Client, Server]),
 1022: 
 1023:     ssl_test_lib:check_result(Server, ServerMsg, Client, ClientMsg),
 1024: 
 1025:     ssl_test_lib:close(Server),
 1026:     ssl_test_lib:close(Client).
 1027: 
 1028: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
 1029: sockname() ->
 1030:     [{doc,"Test API function sockname/1"}].
 1031: sockname(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1032:     ClientOpts = ssl_test_lib:ssl_options(client_rsa_opts, Config),
 1033:     ServerOpts = ssl_test_lib:ssl_options(server_rsa_opts, Config),
 1034:     {ClientNode, ServerNode, Hostname} = ssl_test_lib:run_where(Config),
 1035:     Server = ssl_test_lib:start_server([{node, ServerNode}, {port, 0},
 1036: 					{from, self()},
 1037: 			   {mfa, {ssl, sockname, []}},
 1038: 			   {options, ServerOpts}]),
 1039:     Port = ssl_test_lib:inet_port(Server),
 1040:     Client = ssl_test_lib:start_client([{node, ClientNode}, {port, Port},
 1041: 					{host, Hostname},
 1042:                                         {from, self()},
 1043:                                         {mfa, {ssl, sockname, []}},
 1044:                                         {options, [{port, 0} | ClientOpts]}]),
 1045: 
 1046:     ClientPort = ssl_test_lib:inet_port(Client),
 1047:     ServerIp = ssl_test_lib:node_to_hostip(ServerNode, server),
 1048:     ClientIp = ssl_test_lib:node_to_hostip(ClientNode, client),
 1049:     ServerMsg = {ok, {ServerIp, Port}},
 1050:     ClientMsg = {ok, {ClientIp, ClientPort}},
 1051: 
 1052:     ?CT_LOG("Client ~p  Server ~p ~n", [Client, Server]),
 1053: 
 1054:     ssl_test_lib:check_result(Server, ServerMsg, Client, ClientMsg),
 1055: 
 1056:     ssl_test_lib:close(Server),
 1057:     ssl_test_lib:close(Client).
 1058: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
 1059: tls_server_handshake_timeout() ->
 1060:     [{doc,"Test server handshake timeout"}].
 1061: 
 1062: tls_server_handshake_timeout(Config) ->
 1063:     process_flag(trap_exit, true),
 1064:     ServerOpts = ssl_test_lib:ssl_options(server_rsa_opts, Config),
 1065:     {_, ServerNode, Hostname} = ssl_test_lib:run_where(Config),
 1066:     Server = ssl_test_lib:start_server([{node, ServerNode}, {port, 0},
 1067: 					{from, self()},
 1068: 					{timeout, 5000},
 1069: 					{mfa, {ssl_test_lib,
 1070: 					       no_result_msg, []}},
 1071: 					{options, ServerOpts}]),
 1072:     Port = ssl_test_lib:inet_port(Server),
 1073:     {ok, CSocket} = gen_tcp:connect(Hostname, Port, [binary, {active, true}]),
 1074: 
 1075:     receive
 1076: 	{tcp_closed, CSocket} ->
 1077: 	    ssl_test_lib:check_result(Server, {error, timeout}),
 1078: 	    receive
 1079: 		{'EXIT', Server, _} ->
 1080: 		    %% Make sure supervisor had time to react on process exit
 1081: 		    %% Could we come up with a better solution to this?
 1082: 		    ct:sleep(500),
 1083: 		    [] = supervisor:which_children(tls_connection_sup)
 1084: 	    end
 1085:     end.
 1086: 
 1087: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
 1088: transport_close() ->
 1089:     [{doc, "Test what happens if socket is closed on TCP level after a while of normal operation"}].
 1090: transport_close(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1091:     ClientOpts = ssl_test_lib:ssl_options(client_rsa_opts, Config),
 1092:     ServerOpts = ssl_test_lib:ssl_options(server_rsa_opts, Config),
 1093:     {ClientNode, ServerNode, Hostname} = ssl_test_lib:run_where(Config),
 1094:     Server =
 1095: 	ssl_test_lib:start_server([{node, ServerNode}, {port, 0},
 1096: 				   {from, self()},
 1097: 				   {mfa, {ssl_test_lib, send_recv_result, []}},
 1098: 				   {options,  [{active, false} | ServerOpts]}]),
 1099:     Port = ssl_test_lib:inet_port(Server),
 1100: 
 1101:     {ok, Socket} = case proplists:get_value(transport, Config) of
 1102:                        socket ->
 1103:                            rpc:call(ClientNode, tls_socket_tcp, connect,
 1104:                                     [Hostname,Port,[binary, {active, false}], infinity]);
 1105:                        _ ->
 1106:                            rpc:call(ClientNode, gen_tcp, connect,
 1107:                                     [Hostname,Port,[binary, {active, false}]])
 1108:                    end,
 1109: 
 1110:     {ok, SslS} = rpc:call(ClientNode, ssl, connect,
 1111: 			  [Socket,[{active, false}|ClientOpts]]),
 1112: 
 1113:     ?CT_LOG("Server ~p ~n", [Server]),
 1114:     ok = ssl:send(SslS, "Hello world"),
 1115:     {ok,<<"Hello world">>} = ssl:recv(SslS, 11),
 1116:     case proplists:get_value(transport, Config) of
 1117:         socket ->
 1118:             socket:close(Socket);
 1119:         _ ->
 1120:             gen_tcp:close(Socket)
 1121:     end,
 1122:     {error, _} = ssl:send(SslS, "Hello world").
 1123: 
 1124: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
 1125: transport_close_in_inital_hello() ->
 1126:     [{doc, "Test what happens if server dies after calling transport_accept but before initiating handshake."}].
 1127: transport_close_in_inital_hello(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1128:     _ClientOpts = ssl_test_lib:ssl_options(client_rsa_opts, Config),
 1129:     ServerOpts = ssl_test_lib:ssl_options(server_rsa_opts, Config),
 1130:     {_, _, Hostname} = ssl_test_lib:run_where(Config),
 1131:     process_flag(trap_exit, true),
 1132: 
 1133:     Testcase = self(),
 1134: 
 1135:     Acceptor = spawn_link(fun() ->
 1136:                                   {ok, Listen} = ssl:listen(0, ServerOpts),
 1137:                                   {ok, {_, Port}} = ssl:sockname(Listen),
 1138:                                   Testcase ! {port, Port},
 1139:                                   {ok, _Accept} = ssl:transport_accept(Listen),
 1140:                                   receive
 1141:                                       die -> ok
 1142:                                   end
 1143:                           end),
 1144:     Port =  receive
 1145:                 {port, Port0} ->
 1146:                     Port0
 1147:             end,
 1148: 
 1149:     Connector = spawn_link(fun() ->
 1150:                                    {ok, _} = ssl:connect(Hostname, Port,
 1151:                                                          [{verify, verify_none}],
 1152:                                                          infinity
 1153:                                                         )
 1154:                            end),
 1155: 
 1156: 
 1157:     Sup = (whereis(tls_connection_sup)),
 1158: 
 1159:     check_connection_processes(Sup, 2),
 1160: 
 1161:     Acceptor ! die,
 1162: 
 1163:     receive
 1164:          {'EXIT', Acceptor, _} ->
 1165:             ok
 1166:     end,
 1167:     receive
 1168:         {'EXIT', Connector, _} ->
 1169:             ok
 1170:      end,
 1171:     check_connection_processes(Sup, 0).
 1172: 
 1173: check_connection_processes(Sup, N) ->
 1174:     check_connection_processes(Sup, N, 5).
 1175: 
 1176: check_connection_processes(Sup, N, 0) ->
 1177:     N = count_children(supervisors, Sup);
 1178: check_connection_processes(Sup, N, M) ->
 1179:     case count_children(supervisors, Sup) of
 1180:         N ->
 1181:             ok;
 1182:         _ ->
 1183:             ct:sleep(500),
 1184:             check_connection_processes(Sup, N, M-1)
 1185:     end.
 1186: 
 1187: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
 1188: emulated_options() ->
 1189:     [{doc,"Test API function getopts/2 and setopts/2"}].
 1190: 
 1191: emulated_options(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1192:     ClientOpts = ssl_test_lib:ssl_options(client_rsa_opts, Config),
 1193:     ServerOpts = ssl_test_lib:ssl_options(server_rsa_opts, Config),
 1194:     {ClientNode, ServerNode, Hostname} = ssl_test_lib:run_where(Config),
 1195:     Values = [{mode, list}, {packet, 0}, {header, 0},
 1196: 		      {active, true}],
 1197:     %% Shall be the reverse order of Values!
 1198:     Options = [active, header, packet, mode],
 1199: 
 1200:     NewValues = [{mode, binary}, {active, once}],
 1201:     %% Shall be the reverse order of NewValues!
 1202:     NewOptions = [active, mode],
 1203: 
 1204:     Server = ssl_test_lib:start_server([{node, ServerNode}, {port, 0},
 1205: 					{from, self()},
 1206: 			   {mfa, {?MODULE, tls_socket_options_result,
 1207: 				  [Options, Values, NewOptions, NewValues]}},
 1208: 			   {options, ServerOpts}]),
 1209:     Port = ssl_test_lib:inet_port(Server),
 1210:     Client = ssl_test_lib:start_client([{node, ClientNode}, {port, Port},
 1211: 					{host, Hostname},
 1212: 			   {from, self()},
 1213: 			   {mfa, {?MODULE, tls_socket_options_result,
 1214: 				  [Options, Values, NewOptions, NewValues]}},
 1215: 			   {options, ClientOpts}]),
 1216: 
 1217:     ssl_test_lib:check_result(Server, ok, Client, ok),
 1218: 
 1219:     ssl_test_lib:close(Server),
 1220: 
 1221:     {ok, Listen} = ssl:listen(0, ServerOpts),
 1222:     {ok,[{mode,list}]} = ssl:getopts(Listen, [mode]),
 1223:     ok = ssl:setopts(Listen, [{mode, binary}]),
 1224:     {ok,[{mode, binary}]} = ssl:getopts(Listen, [mode]),
 1225:     {ok,[{recbuf, _}]} = ssl:getopts(Listen, [recbuf]),
 1226:     ssl:close(Listen).
 1227: accept_pool() ->
 1228:     [{doc,"Test having an accept pool."}].
 1229: accept_pool(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1230:     ClientOpts = ssl_test_lib:ssl_options(client_rsa_opts, Config),
 1231:     ServerOpts = ssl_test_lib:ssl_options(server_rsa_opts, Config),
 1232: 
 1233:     {ClientNode, ServerNode, Hostname} = ssl_test_lib:run_where(Config),
 1234:     Server0 = ssl_test_lib:start_server([{node, ServerNode}, {port, 0},
 1235: 					{from, self()},
 1236: 					{accepters, 3},
 1237: 					{mfa, {ssl_test_lib, send_recv_result_active, []}},
 1238: 					{options, ServerOpts}]),
 1239:     Port = ssl_test_lib:inet_port(Server0),
 1240:     [Server1, Server2] = ssl_test_lib:accepters(2),
 1241: 
 1242:     Client0 = ssl_test_lib:start_client([{node, ClientNode}, {port, Port},
 1243: 					 {host, Hostname},
 1244: 					 {from, self()},
 1245: 					 {mfa, {ssl_test_lib, send_recv_result_active, []}},
 1246: 					 {options, ClientOpts}
 1247: 					]),
 1248: 
 1249:     Client1 = ssl_test_lib:start_client([{node, ClientNode}, {port, Port},
 1250: 					 {host, Hostname},
 1251: 					 {from, self()},
 1252: 					 {mfa, {ssl_test_lib, send_recv_result_active, []}},
 1253: 					 {options, ClientOpts}
 1254: 					]),
 1255: 
 1256:     Client2 = ssl_test_lib:start_client([{node, ClientNode}, {port, Port},
 1257: 					 {host, Hostname},
 1258: 					 {from, self()},
 1259: 					 {mfa, {ssl_test_lib, send_recv_result_active, []}},
 1260: 					 {options, ClientOpts}
 1261: 					]),
 1262: 
 1263:     ssl_test_lib:check_ok([Server0, Server1, Server2, Client0, Client1, Client2]),
 1264: 
 1265:     ssl_test_lib:close(Server0),
 1266:     ssl_test_lib:close(Server1),
 1267:     ssl_test_lib:close(Server2),
 1268:     ssl_test_lib:close(Client0),
 1269:     ssl_test_lib:close(Client1),
 1270:     ssl_test_lib:close(Client2).
 1271:

 1311: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
 1312: tls_password_correct() ->
 1313:     [{doc, "Test that connection is possible with a correct password"}].
 1314: tls_password_correct(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1315:     F = fun (P) ->
 1316:                 ProtectedClientOpts = ssl_test_lib:ssl_options(client_protected_rsa_opts, Config),
 1317:                 ServerOpts = ssl_test_lib:ssl_options(server_rsa_opts, Config),
 1318: 
 1319:                 {ClientNode, ServerNode, Hostname} = ssl_test_lib:run_where(Config),
 1320:                 Server = ssl_test_lib:start_server([{node, ServerNode}, {port, 0},
 1321:                                                     {from, self()},
 1322:                                                     {mfa, {ssl_test_lib, send_recv_result, []}},
 1323:                                                     {options, [{active, false} | ServerOpts]}]),
 1324:                 Port = ssl_test_lib:inet_port(Server),
 1325:                 Client = ssl_test_lib:start_client([{node, ClientNode}, {port, Port},
 1326:                                                     {host, Hostname},
 1327:                                                     {from, self()},
 1328:                                                     {mfa,
 1329:                                                      {ssl_test_lib, send_recv_result, []}},
 1330:                                                     {options,
 1331:                                                      [{verify, verify_none},
 1332:                                                       {active, false},
 1333:                                                       {password, P} | ProtectedClientOpts]}]),
 1334:                 ssl_test_lib:check_result(Server, ok, Client, ok),
 1335:                 ssl_test_lib:close(Server),
 1336:                 ssl_test_lib:close(Client)
 1337:         end,
 1338:     F(?CORRECT_PASSWORD),
 1339:     F(fun() -> ?CORRECT_PASSWORD end).
 1340: 
 1341: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
 1342: tls_password_incorrect() ->
 1343:     [{doc, "Test that connection is not possible with wrong password"}].
 1344: tls_password_incorrect(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1345:     F = fun (P) ->
 1346:                 ProtectedClientOpts = ssl_test_lib:ssl_options(client_protected_rsa_opts, Config),
 1347:                 ServerOpts = ssl_test_lib:ssl_options(server_rsa_opts, Config),
 1348: 
 1349:                 {ClientNode, ServerNode, Hostname} = ssl_test_lib:run_where(Config),
 1350:                 Server = ssl_test_lib:start_server_error([{node, ServerNode}, {port, 0},
 1351:                                                           {from, self()},
 1352:                                                           {mfa, ssl_test_lib, no_result},
 1353:                                                           {options, [{active, false} | ServerOpts]}]),
 1354:                 Port = ssl_test_lib:inet_port(Server),
 1355:                 Client = ssl_test_lib:start_client_error([{node, ClientNode}, {port, Port},
 1356:                                                           {host, Hostname},
 1357:                                                           {from, self()},
 1358:                                                           {mfa, ssl_test_lib, no_result},
 1359:                                                           {options,
 1360:                                                            [{active, false},
 1361:                                                             {verify, verify_none},
 1362:                                                             {password, P} | ProtectedClientOpts]}]),
 1363:                 Results = ssl_test_lib:get_result([Server, Client]),
 1364:                 Pred = fun({Pid, {error, closed}}) ->
 1365:                                Server == Pid;
 1366:                           ({Pid, {error, {options, {keyfile, _, {error, _}}}}}) ->
 1367:                                Client == Pid;
 1368:                           (_) -> false
 1369:                        end,
 1370:                 true = lists:all(Pred, Results)
 1371:         end,
 1372:     F(?INCORRECT_PASSWORD),
 1373:     F(fun() -> ?INCORRECT_PASSWORD end).
 1374: 
 1375: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
 1376: tls_password_badarg() ->
 1377:     [{doc, "Test that connection is not possible with badarg password"}].
 1378: tls_password_badarg(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1379:     F = fun (P, ServerError, ClientError) ->
 1380:                 ProtectedClientOpts = ssl_test_lib:ssl_options(client_protected_rsa_opts, Config),
 1381:                 ServerOpts = ssl_test_lib:ssl_options(server_rsa_opts, Config),
 1382:                 {ClientNode, ServerNode, Hostname} = ssl_test_lib:run_where(Config),
 1383:                 Server = ssl_test_lib:start_server_error([{node, ServerNode}, {port, 0},
 1384:                                                           {from, self()},
 1385:                                                           {mfa, ssl_test_lib, no_result},
 1386:                                                           {timeout, 100},
 1387:                                                           {options, [{active, false} | ServerOpts]}]),
 1388:                 Port = ssl_test_lib:inet_port(Server),
 1389:                 Client = ssl_test_lib:start_client_error([{node, ClientNode}, {port, Port},
 1390:                                                           {host, Hostname},
 1391:                                                           {from, self()},
 1392:                                                           {mfa, ssl_test_lib, no_result},
 1393:                                                           {options,
 1394:                                                            [{active, false},
 1395:                                                             {verify, verify_none},
 1396:                                                             {password, P} | ProtectedClientOpts]}]),
 1397:                 ssl_test_lib:check_result(Server, ServerError, Client, ClientError)
 1398:         end,
 1399:     %% {options error comes from ssl app
 1400:     F(?BADARG_PASSWORD, {error, timeout},
 1401:       {error, {options, {password, ?BADARG_PASSWORD}}}),
 1402:     %% {keyfile, badarg} error comes from crypto:macN, also handhsake is initiated
 1403:     %% so different server error is observed
 1404:     F(fun() -> ?BADARG_PASSWORD end, {error, closed},
 1405:       {error, {keyfile,badarg}}).
 1406: 
 1407: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
 1408: signature_algs() ->
 1409:     [{doc, "Check that listing of signature algorithms for different version and configure combinations"}].
 1410: signature_algs(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1411:     true = [] =/= [Alg || Alg <- ssl:signature_algs(default, 'tlsv1.3'), is_tuple(Alg)],
 1412:     true = [] == [Alg || Alg <- ssl:signature_algs(exclusive, 'tlsv1.3'), is_tuple(Alg)],
 1413:     true = ssl:signature_algs(exclusive, 'tlsv1.3') =/=  ssl:signature_algs(exclusive, 'tlsv1.2'),
 1414:     true = length(ssl:signature_algs(default, 'tlsv1.2')) <
 1415:         length(ssl:signature_algs(all, 'tlsv1.2')),
 1416:     TLS_1_3_All = ssl:signature_algs(all, 'tlsv1.3'),
 1417:     true = lists:member(rsa_pkcs1_sha512, TLS_1_3_All) andalso (not lists:member({sha512, rsa}, TLS_1_3_All)),
 1418:     true = lists:member(rsa_pkcs1_sha384, TLS_1_3_All) andalso (not lists:member({sha384, rsa}, TLS_1_3_All)),
 1419:     true = lists:member(rsa_pkcs1_sha256, TLS_1_3_All) andalso (not lists:member({sha256, rsa}, TLS_1_3_All)),
 1420:     true = lists:member(rsa_pkcs1_sha, TLS_1_3_All) andalso (not lists:member({sha, rsa}, TLS_1_3_All)),
 1421:     true = lists:member(ecdsa_sha1, TLS_1_3_All) andalso (not lists:member({sha, ecdsa}, TLS_1_3_All)),
 1422:     TLS_1_2_All = ssl:signature_algs(all, 'tlsv1.2'),
 1423:     true = (not lists:member(rsa_pkcs1_sha512, TLS_1_2_All)) andalso lists:member({sha512, rsa}, TLS_1_2_All),
 1424:     true = (not lists:member(rsa_pkcs1_sha384, TLS_1_2_All)) andalso lists:member({sha384, rsa}, TLS_1_2_All),
 1425:     true = (not lists:member(rsa_pkcs1_sha256, TLS_1_2_All)) andalso lists:member({sha256, rsa}, TLS_1_2_All),
 1426:     true = (not lists:member(rsa_pkcs1_sha, TLS_1_2_All)) andalso lists:member({sha, rsa}, TLS_1_2_All),
 1427:     true = (not lists:member(ecdsa_sha1, TLS_1_2_All)) andalso lists:member({sha, ecdsa}, TLS_1_2_All),
 1428:     All = ssl_cipher:signature_schemes_1_2(ssl:signature_algs(default, 'tlsv1.3')),
 1429:     true = length(All) == length(lists:uniq(All)).
 1430: 
 1431: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
 1432: %% Internal functions ------------------------------------------------
 1433: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
 1434: 
 1435: upgrade_result(Socket) ->
 1436:     ssl:setopts(Socket, [{active, true}]),
 1437:     ok = ssl:send(Socket, "Hello world"),
 1438:     %% Make sure binary is inherited from tcp socket and that we do
 1439:     %% not get the list default!
 1440:     <<"Hello world">> = ssl_test_lib:active_recv(Socket, length("Hello world")),
 1441:     ok.
 1442: 
 1443: upgrade_result_new_opts(Socket) ->
 1444:     ssl:setopts(Socket, [{active, true}]),
 1445:     ok = ssl:send(Socket, "Hello world"),
 1446:     %% Make sure list option set in ssl:connect/handshake overrides
 1447:     %% previous gen_tcp socket option that was set to binary.
 1448:     "Hello world" =  ssl_test_lib:active_recv(Socket, length("Hello world")),
 1449:     ok.
 1450: 
 1451: tls_downgrade_result(Socket, Pid) ->
 1452:     ok = ssl_test_lib:send_recv_result(Socket),
 1453:     Pid ! {self(), ready},
 1454:     receive
 1455:         go ->
 1456:             ok
 1457:     end,
 1458:     case ssl:close(Socket, {self(), 10000})  of
 1459:         {ok, {'$socket', _} = TCPSocket} ->
 1460:             ok = socket:send(TCPSocket, <<"Downgraded">>),
 1461:             {ok, <<"Downgraded">>} = socket:recv(TCPSocket, length("Downgraded")),
 1462:             ok;
 1463: 	{ok, TCPSocket} ->
 1464:             inet:setopts(TCPSocket, [{active, true}]),
 1465: 	    gen_tcp:send(TCPSocket, "Downgraded"),
 1466:             <<"Downgraded">> = active_tcp_recv(TCPSocket, length("Downgraded")),
 1467:             ok;
 1468: 	{ok, TCPSocket, Bin} ->
 1469: 	    gen_tcp:send(TCPSocket, "Downgraded"),
 1470:             <<"Downgraded">> = Bin,
 1471:             ok;
 1472: 	{error, timeout} ->
 1473: 	    ct:comment("Timed out, downgrade aborted"),
 1474: 	    ok;
 1475: 	Fail ->
 1476:             ct:fail(Fail)
 1477:     end.
 1478: 
 1479: tls_shutdown_result(Socket, server) ->
 1480:     ok = ssl:send(Socket, "Hej"),
 1481:     ok = ssl:shutdown(Socket, write),
 1482:     {ok, "Hej hopp"} = ssl:recv(Socket, 8),
 1483:     ok;
 1484: 
 1485: tls_shutdown_result(Socket, client) ->
 1486:     ok = ssl:send(Socket, "Hej hopp"),
 1487:     ok = ssl:shutdown(Socket, write),
 1488:     {ok, "Hej"} = ssl:recv(Socket, 3),
 1489:     ok.
 1490: 
 1491: tls_shutdown_write_result(Socket, server) ->
 1492:     ct:sleep(?SLEEP),
 1493:     ssl:shutdown(Socket, write);
 1494: tls_shutdown_write_result(Socket, client) ->
 1495:     ssl:recv(Socket, 0).
 1496: 
 1497: tls_shutdown_both_result(Socket, server) ->
 1498:     ct:sleep(?SLEEP),
 1499:     ssl:shutdown(Socket, read_write);
 1500: tls_shutdown_both_result(Socket, client) ->
 1501:     ssl:recv(Socket, 0).
 1502: 
 1503: tls_closed_in_active_once_loop(Socket) ->
 1504:     case ssl:setopts(Socket, [{active, once}]) of
 1505:         ok ->
 1506:             receive
 1507:                 {ssl, Socket, _} ->
 1508:                     tls_closed_in_active_once_loop(Socket);
 1509:                 {ssl_closed, Socket} ->
 1510:                     ok
 1511:             end;
 1512:         {error, closed} ->
 1513:             {error, ssl_setopt_failed}
 1514:     end.
 1515: 
 1516: receive_msg(_) ->
 1517:     receive
 1518: 	Msg ->
 1519: 	   Msg
 1520:     end.
 1521: 
 1522: tls_socket_options_result(Socket, Options, DefaultValues, NewOptions, NewValues) ->
 1523:     %% Test get/set emulated opts
 1524:     {ok, DefaultValues} = ssl:getopts(Socket, Options),
 1525:     ssl:setopts(Socket, NewValues),
 1526:     {ok, NewValues} = ssl:getopts(Socket, NewOptions),
 1527:     %% Test get/set inet opts
 1528:     {ok,[{nodelay,false}]} = ssl:getopts(Socket, [nodelay]),
 1529:     ssl:setopts(Socket, [{nodelay, true}]),
 1530:     {ok,[{nodelay, true}]} = ssl:getopts(Socket, [nodelay]),
 1531:     {ok, All} = ssl:getopts(Socket, []),
 1532:     ?CT_LOG("All opts ~p~n", [All]),
 1533:     ok.
 1534: 
 1535: active_tcp_recv(Socket, N) ->
 1536:     active_tcp_recv(Socket, N, []).
 1537: 
 1538: active_tcp_recv(_Socket, 0, Acc) ->
 1539:     Acc;
 1540: active_tcp_recv(Socket, N, Acc) ->
 1541:     receive
 1542: 	{tcp, Socket, Bytes} ->
 1543:             active_tcp_recv(Socket, N-size(Bytes),  Acc ++ Bytes)
 1544:     end.
 1545: 
 1546: tls_monitor_listen_opts('tlsv1.3', Opts) ->
 1547:     [{session_tickets, stateful} | Opts];
 1548: tls_monitor_listen_opts(_, Opts) ->
 1549:     Opts.
 1550: 
 1551: tls_monitor_client_opts('tlsv1.3', Opts) ->
 1552:     [{session_tickets, auto} | Opts];
 1553: tls_monitor_client_opts(_, Opts) ->
 1554:     Opts.
 1555: 
 1556: session_info('tlsv1.3') ->
 1557:     count_children(workers, tls_server_session_ticket_sup);
 1558: session_info(_) ->
 1559:     count_children(workers, ssl_server_session_cache_sup).
 1560: 
 1561: count_children(ChildType, SupRef) ->
 1562:     proplists:get_value(ChildType, supervisor:count_children(SupRef)).
 1563: 
 1564: 
 1565: new_versions('tlsv1.3') ->
 1566:     ['tlsv1.2'];
 1567: new_versions('tlsv1.2') ->
 1568:     ['tlsv1.1'];
 1569: new_versions('tlsv1.1') ->
 1570:     ['tlsv1'];
 1571: new_versions('tlsv1') ->
 1572:     ['tlsv1'].
